intro: Cynoglossum officinale var. villosum, commonly known as hairy mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves and small, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along pathways. The hairy texture of its leaves and stems is a distinguishing feature of this variety.
